Line 76: Line 76:
==Overview==
==Overview==
â
[[File:Hamad-Bin-Isa-Al-Khalifa.jpg|thumb|King Hamad has instigated the [[Bahrain Independent Commission of Inquiry]] to look into the events of the uprising, following calls for an end to his rule.]]
+
[[File:Hamad-Bin-Isa-Al-Khalifa.jpg|thumb|left|King Hamad has instigated the [[Bahrain Independent Commission of Inquiry]] to look into the events of the uprising, following calls for an end to his rule.]]
The date 14 February 2011 was chosen because it was the tenth anniversary of a referendum in favour of the [[National Action Charter of Bahrain]].<ref name="bchr_gov_panic" /> Bahraini youths described their plans as an appeal for Bahrainis "to take to the streets on Monday 14 February in a peaceful and orderly manner" in order to rewrite the [[Constitution of Bahrain|constitution]] and to establish a body with a "full popular mandate to investigate and hold to account [[human rights in Bahrain|economic, political and social violations]], including stolen public wealth, political naturalisation, arrests, [[torture in Bahrain|torture]] and other oppressive security measures, ''[and]'' institutional and economic corruption."<ref name="aljaz_febdominos">{{cite news|author = [[Staff writer]]|title= Calls for Weekend Protests in Syria â Social Media Used in Bid To Mobilise Syrians for Rallies Demanding Freedom, Human Rights and the End to Emergency Law|date=4 February 2011|publisher = [[Al Jazeera]]|url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2011/02/201122171649677912.html |accessdate=31 March 2011 |archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/5wLygnerq |archivedate=8 February 2011 |deadurl=no }}</ref><ref name="bahrainonline_20110214">{{verify credibility|date=March 2011|reason=what are credentials of this site? site in arabic. from limited english provided on linked page, site appear to be user-generated. also, appears to be a dynamic page resulting in a dead link}} {{dead link|date=March 2011}} {{clarify|date=March 2011|reason=site is primarily in Arabic. at minimum, needs Arabic "headline" appended in "title" field next to "trans_title" field}} {{cite web | trans_title = A Statement by Bahraini Youth for Freedom Published on BahrainOnline | language = Arabic | publisher =[[bahrainonline.com]] | url = http://bahrainonline.info.tm/ | accessdate=27 February 2011 | archiveurl = http://www.webcitation.org/5wKQYGf0Q | archivedate=7 February 2011 |deadurl=no }}</ref> They referred to the uprisings in Tunisia and Egypt as motivations for their appeal.<ref name="bahrainonline_20110214" /> [[Al Wefaq|Al Wefaq National Islamic Society]], which won a plurality in the recent parliamentary election, participated in the planning for demonstrations on 14 February.<ref name="ThReut_">{{clarify|date=March 2011|reason=who is "IFR"}} {{cite news | author = [[Staff writer]] | title = IFR: Bahrain Set To Test Egyptian Contagion | date=11 February 2011 | publisher= [[IFR]]{{disambiguation needed|date=March 2011}} (via [[Reuters]]) | url = http://www.reuters.com/article/2011/02/10/emerging-markets-bahrain-idUSLDE71924E20110210?sp=true | accessdate=31 March 2011 | archiveurl = http://www.webcitation.org/5wQa6Joby | archivedate=11 February 2011 |deadurl=no }}</ref> The [[Bahrain Centre for Human Rights]] described authorities' preparations for the 14 February planned demonstrations as "a state of confusion, apprehension and anticipation".<ref name="latimes_BCHR" /> On 11 February, King [[Hamad ibn Isa Al Khalifa]] ordered that {{currency|1000|BHD|first=true}} (approximately {{currency|2667|USD}}) be given to "each family" to celebrate the tenth anniversary of the [[National Action Charter of Bahrain|National Action Charter]] referendum.<ref name="AFP_3kdollars">{{cite news | author = [[Staff writer]] | title = Bahrain's King Gifts $3,000 to Every Family | date=11 February 2011 | publisher = [[Agence France-Presse]] (via [[France 24]]) | url = http://www.france24.com/en/20110211-bahrains-king-gifts-3000-every-family |accessdate=31 March 2011 | archiveurl = http://www.webcitation.org/5wQZVfMVZ | archivedate=11 February 2011 |deadurl=no }}</ref> [[Agence France-Presse]] linked the {{currency|1000|BHD}} payments to the 14 February demonstration plans.<ref name="AFP_3kdollars" />
The date 14 February 2011 was chosen because it was the tenth anniversary of a referendum in favour of the [[National Action Charter of Bahrain]].<ref name="bchr_gov_panic" /> Bahraini youths described their plans as an appeal for Bahrainis "to take to the streets on Monday 14 February in a peaceful and orderly manner" in order to rewrite the [[Constitution of Bahrain|constitution]] and to
